Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Adjuvant Interferon Therapy in Hepatitis B-Related Hepatocellular Carcinoma

Trial_Design.evidence: randomly assigned to no treatment (control) or interferon alpha-2b 10 MIU/m² thrice weekly for 16 weeks (IFN-I group)

Participants.evidence: patients with no residual disease after hepatic resection for HCC, predominantly hepatitis B-related, from February 1999 to June 2002

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to no treatment (control) or interferon alpha-2b 10 MIU/m² thrice weekly for 16 weeks (IFN-I group)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was overall survival, measured at 1 and 5 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment

Number_Randomised.evidence: Eighty patients were randomised: 40 to the control group and 40 to the IFN-I group

Number_Analysed.evidence: Eighty patients were randomised: 40 to the control group and 40 to the IFN-I group

Result_Outcome.evidence: The relative risk of death for interferon treatment was 0.42 (95% CI, 0.17–1.05; P = 0.063)

Harms.evidence: Adverse effects led to treatment discontinuation in the higher dose group

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided
